result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody L Borden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CF358, 15CM404, and 15CM405 called together at 2:22pm [mo]
Defendant Cody L Borden in court, in custody with Attorney Thomas J. McClure.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Cases 15CM404 and 15CM405:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2 of Case 15CM404 and Counts #1 and #4 of Case 15CM405; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

recess: 2:30pm--reconvene: 2:35pm

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 of Case 15CM404 and Counts #2 and #3 of Case 15CM405

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
On Case 15CF358, the Court sentences Mr. Borden to 7 months county jail, WITHOUT Huber, to commence FORTHWITH

On Case 15CM404, Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Borden to serve 60 days in the county jail, WITHOUT Huber, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF358

On Case 15CM405, Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Borden to serve 60 days in the county jail, WITHOUT Huber, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF358 and 15CM404

On Case 15CM405, Count #4, the Court sentences Mr. Borden to serve 5 months in the county jail, WITHOUT Huber, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF358 and 15CM404


The Court orders Mr. Borden to pay:
--As to Case 15CF358, Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $318 in subpoena fees, alt. for non payment is 16 days jail with work release/ Huber, consecutive
--As to Case 15CM404, Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
, alt. for non payment is 9 days jail with work release/ Huber, consecutive

--As to Case 15CM405, Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--As to Case 15CM405, Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge, alt. for non payment is 22 days jail with work release/ Huber, consecutive

All costs and fees are to be paid in installments of $30 per month beginning 2/25/2017 and on the 25th day of each month.
The Court orders Mr. Borden to provide DNA sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served:  96  days
 (to be applied to 15CF358)

Atty. McClure inquires of the status of return of Mr. Borden's cell phone. 
recess: 4:41pm

Cases 15CF358, 15CM404 and 15CM405 called together at 2:30pm [mo]
Defendant Cody L Borden in court with Attorney Thomas J. McClure.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to the Defendant's Motion to Suppress:
--Arguments given by Counsel
The Court denies the Defendant's Motion to Suppress

As to the Defendant's Motion to Compel:
--Arguments given by Counsel
The Court addresses Paragraphs within the Defendant's Motion to Compel
The Court will not allow the admission of evidence/information obtained from the cell phone at Trial

As to the Defendant's Motion to Admit Statements: 
--The Court makes rulings as to admission of statements; will be addressed further on day of Trial

As to the State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions:
--Arguments given by Counsel
The Court finds for purposes of Trial Mr. Borden has 2 prior convictions

As to State's Motion in Limine
The Court grants all paragraphs in the State's Motion in Limine

Defense's Response to State's Intent to Admit Defendant's Statements:
As to Paragraph 2: The Court will allow the admission of this statement
As to Paragraph 3: The Court will allow the admission of this statement
As to Paragraph 5: The Court will allow the admission of this statement 

As to the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond:
--Arguments given by Counsel 
The Court denies the Defendant's Motion as it relates to monetary and non-monetary conditions.
recess: 3:21pm

Cases 15CM404 & 15CM405 recalled together at 3:28 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Michael Onheiber presiding for BrII]
Defendant Cody L Borden appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
ADA Shock informs the Court the parties have joint recommendation to modify bond, presents basis including concerns on mental healt

On Motion of the Parties, the Court MODIFIES BOND
 to also include a No Contact provision with Angela and Robert Harris
Recess: 3:31 pm 

NEXT: (1) Cases to remain as scheduled
COVERS 15CM404 & 15CM405

Cases 15CM404 & 15CM405 called together at 1:25 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Michael Onheiber presiding for BrII]
Defendant Cody L Borden in court with Attorney Whtiney Hagemann. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hagemann informs the Court that Mr. Borden qualifies for SPD Services

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, to cover both files, with conditions: 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No contact with Angela Harris, Tristen Borden or PDB
-No presence at 605 Autumn Crest Dr. Watertown  
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Angela or Robert Harris
Recess: 1:33 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 11/25/15 at 3:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 12/29/15 at 10:30 am - Send notices
